element.name: Vehicular, Pedestrian, or Other Injury Risk Factor
element.definition: The kind of risk factor predictors present at the incident
element.v3Comment: Added additional mechanism or risk indicators based on CDC 2011 Guidelines for the Field Triage of Injured Patients Step 3.
element.v3Changes:
Added to better evaluate the CDC-ACS 2011 Guidelines for the Field Triage of Injured Patients.
Website: http://www.cdc.gov/FieldTriage/

facet.name: enumeration
facet.annotation: Auto v. Pedestrian/Bicyclist Thrown, Run Over, or > 20 MPH Impact

facet.name: enumeration
facet.annotation: Fall Adults: > 20 ft. (one story is equal to 10 ft.)

facet.name: enumeration
facet.annotation: Fall Children: > 10 ft. or 2-3 times the height of the child

facet.name: enumeration
facet.annotation: Crash Death in Same Passenger Compartment

facet.name: enumeration
facet.annotation: Crash Ejection (partial or complete) from vehicle

facet.name: enumeration
facet.annotation: Crash Intrusion, including roof: > 12 in. occupant site; > 18 in. any site

facet.name: enumeration
facet.annotation: Crash Vehicle Telemetry Data (AACN) Consistent with High Risk of Injury
